instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PM_SLP_SUS_L:
What is PM_SLP_SUS_L? 
The "PM_SLP_SUS_L" signal in a MacBook is related to the power management of the device, specifically concerning the 'suspend to RAM' state or S3 state. It's an active-low signal that, when asserted (low voltage), indicates the system should enter or is in the S3 sleep state. .
definitions.SMC_BATLOW_L: What is SMC_BATLOW_L? SMC_BATLOW_L refers to a power management signal that indicates a low battery condition. The "_L" suffix suggests that this is an active-low signal, meaning that it becomes low when the battery reaches a low voltage threshold..
definitions.AVREF_SMC: What is AVREF_SMC? AVREF_SMC is a reference voltage provided to the SMC so that its sensors have a reference to work from, this should be 3.3v.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.CHGR_CSO_N: What is CHGR_CSO_N? CHGR_CSO_N is one of the current sense lines for the battery. Resistance between CHGR_CSO_N and CHGR_CSO_P should be the resistance should be the total series resistance of the current sense resistors in the circuit, usually about 2.2 ohms.
definitions.CHGR_CSO_P: What is CHGR_CSO_P? CHGR_CSO_P is one of the current sense lines for the battery. Resistance between CHGR_CSO_P and CHGR_CSO_N should be the resistance should be the total series resistance of the current sense resistors in the circuit, usually about 2.2 ohms.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
hello. i have <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board. it doesn't have any visual damage. it doesn't have <SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>.<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_SUS_L</SIGNAL>  present. please advice me from where should i start? in <SIGNAL>SMC_BYPASS</SIGNAL>  mode it's started and presents <SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> 3.3V!

<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_SUS_L</SIGNAL>    3.3V

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>  -   0V     no short to ground

<SIGNAL>P3V3SUS_EN_L</SIGNAL>     3.3V

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 12.58v   with/without battery on 85w charger

<SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SMC_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> with and without battery have 0v

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> -- 3.3V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>
threads.message: how do you think is the <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> problem?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>
threads.message: no one can advice  me what should i check in this situation?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
"in <SIGNAL>SMC_BYPASS</SIGNAL>  mode it's started and presents <SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> 3.3V"
Does it boot then, or just stays on without any activity?

Check <SIGNAL>AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL> voltage.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
yes its booted in smc bypass mode there is chime, apple logo, loading bar about 60% and than restart and same ....

<SIGNAL>AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL>  have 3.3v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Then you have problems with some I/V sensor (pages 48 & 49).
Check ohm resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
resistance between pins 

17/18 is 3.6 ohm    and voltage is 12.57v for <SIGNAL>CHGR_CSO_N</SIGNAL> and same 12.57v on <SIGNAL>CHGR_CSO_P</SIGNAL>

 27/28 is 21.2 ohm      and voltage is 16.v for both <SIGNAL>CHGR_CSIN</SIGNAL>/p

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
during this state <SIGNAL>SMC_PBUS_VSENSE</SIGNAL> must be or not ?  there is 0v

<SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN_VSENSE</SIGNAL> have 2.7v

<SIGNAL>SMC_CPU_VSENSE</SIGNAL>   0v

<SIGNAL>SMC_GFX_VSENSE</SIGNAL> 0v

<SIGNAL>SMC_GPU_ISENSE</SIGNAL> 0v

<SIGNAL>SMC_GPU_VSENSE</SIGNAL> 0v

<SIGNAL>SMC_CPUVCCIO_ISENSE</SIGNAL> 0v

<SIGNAL>SMC_SA_ISENSE</SIGNAL>   0v

<SIGNAL>SMC_P1V5S3_ISENSE</SIGNAL>  0v

<SIGNAL>SMC_CPU_HI_ISENSE</SIGNAL>  0.6v


<SIGNAL>SMC_GPU_HI_ISENSE</SIGNAL>  0.68v

<SIGNAL>SMC_OTHER_HI_ISENSE</SIGNAL>  0.68v

<SIGNAL>SMC_BMON_ISENSE</SIGNAL> 0.05v

<SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN_ISENSE</SIGNAL>  0.2v


<SIGNAL>SMC_CPU_ISENSE</SIGNAL>  0v

<SIGNAL>SMC_GFX_ISENSE</SIGNAL>  0v

p.s during this testing i suddenly saw that green light wasn't on the charger. i checked <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and is only 0.9-1v.  tried detach and plug several times and nothing changed. still 1v. during this 2 days it happenes first time. but now still 1v

update: after several detach and plug now back to 12.58v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Are you using 85W original Magsafe 1 charger?
Board still doesn't start with both charger and battery connected?

What said the client about how problem appeared?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>
threads.message: yes i am using original 85w magsafe 1 charger. yes its not start even with both connected battery and charger.

threads.message: i don't have another 85w original magsafe 1 charger. is there any method to check possibility of charger problem? can i test by multimeter on the motherboard if charger is not enough for anything ?
